definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: It inculcates purity and harmony, the mystery of mutual charity, the romanticism of the social order.
sentences.chinese: 茶道主張純淨和諧，仁慈互愛，兼具秩序與浪漫。

sentences.english: The sado is the humanity and tea is always closely related to the moral behavior.
sentences.chinese: 茶道即人道，茶品與人品總是緊密地聯繫在一起。

sentences.english: It is an eclectic mix of Japanese tea drinking and English country garden.
sentences.chinese: 它是日本茶道和英國鄉村花園折衷。

sentences.english: Since then Teaism is fully established in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 從那時起，茶道在日本纔算是完全建立起來了。

sentences.english: A: Is the tea ceremony popular in China?
Reiko: There's some professionals for both flower arrangement and tea ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 在學校有專業的插花和茶道老師。

sentences.english: Guests attending a tea ceremony today go through a ritual that would be entirely familiar to Rikyu.
sentences.chinese: 今天出席茶道的客人都要經歷利休爛熟於胸的儀式。

sentences.english: Similarly venerable is the local tea ceremony, which can last several hours.
sentences.chinese: 歷史同樣悠久的當地茶道要持續數小時。

sentences.english: NO. 1 is a place for you to experience the atmosphere of Sado .
sentences.chinese: 在1號樓，你可以體驗到茶道的氛圍。

sentences.english: Wenfu Teahouse is one of the most enthralling attractions.
sentences.chinese: 文佛山茶道館是景區最有神韻的一景。

sentences.english: But the one activity that he cherished and held in particularly high regard was the stylized formality of the tea ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他珍愛且特別看重的是茶道程式化的儀式。

sentences.english: Sen no Rikyu, a tea-master, wished to hang a flower basket on a column.
sentences.chinese: 茶道宗師千利休想把花籃掛到庭柱上。

definition: very concentrated type of tea drunk in Chaozhou, Fujian and Taiwan
very concentrated type of tea consumed in Chaozhou, Fujian and Taiwan/variant of 功夫茶[gong1 fu5 cha2]
to have tea and refreshments/to have dimsum lunch (Cantonese)
the Classic of Tea, first monograph ever on tea and its culture, written by 陸羽|陆羽[Lu4 Yu3] between 760-780
(fig.) to have a meeting with state security agents (to be warned to behave "responsibly")
guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers
the four arts (zither, Go, calligraphy, painting)/the accomplishments of a well-educated person
